## validatePlugin() function

> This API is provided as an alpha preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 

Validates a plugin conforms to the expected structure.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function validatePlugin(plugin: unknown, options?: PluginValidationOptions): PluginValidationResult;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

plugin


</td><td>

unknown


</td><td>

The plugin to validate (can be any value)


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

options


</td><td>

[PluginValidationOptions](./change-detector-core.pluginvalidationoptions.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Validation options


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[PluginValidationResult](./change-detector-core.pluginvalidationresult.md)

Validation result with errors and warnings

## Remarks

This function performs comprehensive validation including: - Metadata validation (id, name, version) - Capability validation (inputProcessors, policies, reporters, validators) - Unique ID checks within each capability type - Factory function validation (optional)

## Example


```typescript
import { validatePlugin } from '@api-extractor-tools/change-detector-core';

const result = validatePlugin(myPlugin, { packageName: 'my-plugin' });
if (!result.valid) {
  console.error('Plugin validation failed:', result.errors);
}
```
